org.jamesframework.ext.permutation.neigh.moves

Class SingleSwapMove

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jamesframework.ext.permutation.neigh.moves.SingleSwapMove
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Move<PermutationSolution>

    public class SingleSwapMove
extends Object
implements Move<PermutationSolution>
    A move that swaps two items at given positions in a permutation solution.
    Author:
    Herman De Beukelaer

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SingleSwapMove(int i, int j)
      Create a single swap move given the two positions in the permutation at which items are to be swapped.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void apply(PermutationSolution solution)
      Apply the move by swapping the items at the positions specified at construction.
      boolean equals(Object obj)
      Two single swap moves are considered equal if they swap the same pair of items.

      Get the position of the first swapped item.
      int getJ()
      Get the position of the second swapped item.

      Hash code computation corresponding to the implementation of equals(Object).

      • equals

        public boolean equals(Object obj)
        Two single swap moves are considered equal if they swap the same pair of items. The order of i and j is arbitrary.
        Overrides:
        equals in class Object
        Parameters:
        obj - object to compare for equality
        Returns:
        true if the given object is also a single swap move that swaps the same pair of items
